thread.title: EastEnders star Ricky Norwood to leave his role as Fatboy Chubb - EastEnders Soaps -
thread.title_full: EastEnders star Ricky Norwood to leave his role as Fatboy Chubb - EastEnders News - Soaps - Digital Spy

author: Daniel Kilkelly
title: EastEnders star Ricky Norwood to leave his role as Fatboy Chubb - EastEnders Soaps -
text: EastEnders star Ricky Norwood is leaving the show after nearly six years in the role of Fatboy Chubb.The actor will depart the BBC soap at the end of his current contract after producers decided to write out the character of Fatboy. © BBCRicky Norwood as FatBoy in EastEnders. Norwood will film his final scenes within the next few weeks, but bosses are currently keeping quiet about when and how Fatboy will leave Albert Square.An EastEnders spokesperson told Digital Spy: "We can confirm that Ricky will be leaving EastEnders. We wish him all the best for the future."A show insider added: "Ricky is a great guy and very popular on set. He's leaving the show as it's the end of Fatboy's storyline, but everyone wishes him well for the future." © BBCFatboy and Donna in a recent EastEnders episode Norwood first appeared on EastEnders in early 2010, featuring in the main show and its online spinoff E20.He enjoyed early success with his portrayal of fun-loving Fatboy, winning the Best Newcomer prizes at the Inside Soap Awards in 2010 and National Television Awards in 2011.In April 2014, Norwood was suspended from EastEnders for two months for improper conduct, although it's understood that there is no link between the past suspension and the much more recent decision to write out Fatboy.Fatboy's storylines have included his romances with Mercy Olubunmi, Poppy Meadow and Denise Fox. He also shares a strong friendship bond with Albert Square legend Dot Branning and has supported her through many of her own dramas.Read more EastEnders spoilers and newsDigital Spy Soap Scoop video - hit play below for gossip on more Gloved Hand Killer deaths in Hollyoaks, the reveal of Robert Sugden's shooter in Emmerdale, a drastic decision from Kathy Beale in EastEnders and Alya Nazir's guilt spiralling out of control in Coronation Street. function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID); modVP = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.VIDEO_PLAYER); modExp = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.EXPERIENCE); modCon = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.CONTENT); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.BEGIN, onVideoStart); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.STOP, onVideoStop); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.PROGRESS, onVideoProgress); } #_containermyExperience4551550723001 { height: 100%; } // InSkin integration parameters: InSkinParams['myInSkin14551550723001'] = { 'srv_SectionID': '', 'srv_SectionIDPlay': '123757', 'srv_Keywords': '', 'plr_ContentID': 'myExperience4551550723001', 'plr_ContentType': 'BRIGHTCOVE3', 'plr_ContentW': 558, 'plr_ContentH': 314, 'plr_NoSkinContentResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinContentW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinContentH': 348, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinH': 348, 'plr_ResizeOnHideSkin': true, 'plr_HideSkinOnExternalAd': 'all', 'plr_ShowSkinAfterExternalAd': true, 'cnt_SmartPlayer': true }; // create the InSkin object: var InSkinObject4551550723001 = new InSkin.Base('myInSkin14551550723001'); brightcove.createExperiences(); if (!navigator.userAgent.match(/Android/i)) { InSkinObject4551550723001.init(); ai_type="video"; } Get the Inside Soap magazine on your iPhone or iPad
